so like

public String[] owners = {"Me", "You", "Him", "Her"};if (cmd[0].equalsIgnoreCase("npc") try { World.spawnNPC(Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]), player, -1, true, true); return true; } catch (NumberFormatException e) { player.getPackets().sendPanelBoxMessage( "Use: ::npc id(Integer)"); } } something like not really a command coder sorry

Read full topic

item.title: Help please! 667
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

You can initialize an array:

public String[] owners = {"Me", "You", "Him", "Her"};

And then use a loop to find out if a player is part of that array:

public boolean isAnOwner() { for (String s : owners) { if (player.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase(s)) { return true; } } return false; }

Read full topic

item.title: Help please! 667
item.dc:creator: @pkerrr pkerrr
item.description:
@pkerrr wrote:

ok so im using ViacomX and im hosting with another person and i want both of us to have every command. how can i split them i tried like && else if… ect and i keep getting errors please help i will leave an example if u can split it
[code]if (cmd[0].equalsIgnoreCase(“npc”)&& (player.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase(“Anonymous”))) {
try {
World.spawnNPC(Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]), player, -1, true,
true);
return true;
} catch (NumberFormatException e) {
player.getPackets().sendPanelBoxMessage(
“Use: ::npc id(Integer)”);
}
}[/code]

Read full topic
